direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods create an Option instance with similar control flows and exception handling, differing only in the type of the option parameter.
Both methods create an Option instance with similar control flows and exception handling, differing only in the type of the option parameter.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to arguments, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'hasArg' sets the argument count.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to arguments, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'hasArg' sets the argument count conditionally.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to arguments, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'hasArgs' sets the argument count to unlimited.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to arguments, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'hasArgs' sets the argument count to a specified number.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to arguments, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'hasOptionalArg' sets the argument count and marks it as optional.

Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to arguments, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'hasOptionalArgs' sets the argument count to unlimited and marks it as optional.

Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to arguments, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'hasOptionalArgs' sets the argument count to a specified number and marks it as optional.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to the Option's requirement, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'isRequired' sets the requirement flag.

Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to the Option's argument name, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'withArgName' sets the argument name.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to the Option's description, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'withDescription' sets the description.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to the Option's long option, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'withLongOpt' sets the long option.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to the Option's type, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'withType' sets the type.
Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to the Option's value separator, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'withValueSeparator' sets the value separator.

Both methods configure the OptionBuilder to set properties related to the Option's value separator, though 'create' finalizes the Option while 'withValueSeparator' sets the value separator to a specified character.
